meanings.definition: The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.
meanings.sent1: In our small society, everyone knows each other well.
meanings.sent2: The society gathered for a town meeting to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent3: The society of ants worked together to build an impressive anthill.
meanings.sent4: The bustling society of bees in the hive was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: Growing up in a close-knit society like ours teaches valuable lessons about unity.

meanings.definition: An organized group of persons associated together for religious, benevolent, cultural, scientific, political, patriotic, or other purposes.
meanings.sent1: Our society raised funds for the local charity event.
meanings.sent2: The historical society preserves artifacts from the past.
meanings.sent3: The society of book lovers met every week to discuss their favorite reads.
meanings.sent4: Being part of the society of volunteers gave her a sense of fulfillment.
meanings.sent5: The society of artists showcased their work at the gallery opening.

meanings.sent1: The lion society in the savanna was led by a dominant male.
meanings.sent2: The meerkat society worked together to protect their burrows.
meanings.sent3: The penguin society waddled gracefully along the icy shores.
meanings.sent4: Observing the chimpanzee society in the jungle was a fascinating experience.
meanings.sent5: The whale society communicated through intricate songs in the ocean depths.
